context: This evaluation assesses how effectively the engineer uses the humane-js notification library to implement a notification manager with three distinct notification types. The criteria focus specifically on the proper use of humane-js API methods and options.

checklist.name: Uses humane.spawn()
checklist.description: Creates custom notifiers using humane.spawn() with appropriate default options for each notification type (success, error, info), rather than calling humane.log() directly with options each time

checklist.name: Timeout configuration
checklist.description: Correctly configures the timeout option for each notification type: 2000ms for success, 4000ms for info, and appropriate timeout for error messages

checklist.name: Click-to-close setup
checklist.description: Properly uses the clickToClose option to enable click-to-dismiss behavior for error notifications

checklist.name: Callback integration
checklist.description: Correctly passes the onComplete callback parameter to humane-js using the callback parameter of the log method or as part of the options object

checklist.name: Per-message overrides
checklist.description: Implements per-message option overrides for the autoDismiss scenario by passing options to the spawned notifier that override the default clickToClose and timeout settings

checklist.name: CSS class styling
checklist.description: Uses the addnCls option to apply appropriate CSS classes for different notification types (e.g., adding color-specific classes for success/error/info themes)
